content:
XsltLibrary Class

Definition

Implements different XPath and XSLT functions.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsable(System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsableState.Never)]
public sealed class XsltLibrary
Inheritance
System.Object
XsltLibrary

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Methods

CheckScriptNamespace(String)

Checks that the extension and script namespaces do not clash.

public int CheckScriptNamespace (string nsUri);
nsUri
String

The namespace URI.

Returns
Int32

An integer used for internal infrastructure only.

ElementAvailable(XmlQualifiedName)

Evaluates the argument to a string that is an XML qualified name. This method implements the element-available function specified by W3C XSL Transformations (XSLT).

public bool ElementAvailable (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name);
name
XmlQualifiedName

The XML qualified name.

Returns
Boolean

true if the expanded name is the name of an instruction. If the expanded name has a namespace URI equal to the XSLT namespace URI, then it refers to an element defined by XSLT. Otherwise, the expanded-name refers to an extension element. If the expanded name has a null namespace URI, the element-available function will return false.

Remarks

The qualified name is expanded into an expanded name by using the namespace declarations in scope for the expression. The ElementAvailable function returns true if and only if the expanded name is the name of an instruction.

EqualityOperator(Double,IList<XPathItem>,IList<XPathItem>)

Determines equality between collections of type XPathItem.

public bool EqualityOperator (double opCode, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right);
opCode
Double

Double that specifies the operation to be performed

left
IList<XPathItem>

stem.Collections.Generic.IList`1 of type XPathItem.

right
IList<XPathItem>

stem.Collections.Generic.IList`1 of type XPathItem.

Returns
Boolean

Returns true if the collections are equal, otherwise false.

FormatMessage(String,IList<String>)

Formats an exception message composed of a format string supplied by the res parameter and arguments contained by the args parameter.

public string FormatMessage (string res, System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> args);
res
String

A string that contains the message resource.

args
IList<String>

A list of strings that represent arguments to the method.

Returns
String

A string that contains the formatted exception message.

FormatNumberDynamic(Double,String,XmlQualifiedName,String)

Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

public string FormatNumberDynamic (double value, string formatPicture, System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName decimalFormatName, string errorMessageName);
value
Double

Double that contains the value to format.

formatPicture
String

String that contains the format picture.

decimalFormatName
XmlQualifiedName

XmlQualifiedName that contains the format name.

errorMessageName
String

String that contains the error message name.

Returns
String

Returns a string that indicates the number format. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

Remarks

The FormatNumberDynamic method formats value by using the formatPicture and decimal-format expanded name. The errorMessageName is used only for error reporting and must contain the qualified name of the decimal-format object.

FormatNumberStatic(Double,Double)

Implements the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

public string FormatNumberStatic (double value, double decimalFormatterIndex);
value
Double

Double that contains value to format.

decimalFormatterIndex
Double

Double that contains the formatter index.

Returns
String

A string that indicates the format. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

Remarks

The FormatNumberStatic method formats the given value by using the given decimal formatter object, created by RegisterDecimalFormatter.

FunctionAvailable(XmlQualifiedName)

Implements the function-available() XSLT function.

public bool FunctionAvailable (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name);
name
XmlQualifiedName

XmlQualifiedName name object.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value that is true if the function identified by name is available.

IsSameNodeSort(XPathNavigator,XPathNavigator)

Determines whether two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded-names, the same expanded names.

public bool IsSameNodeSort (System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator nav1, System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator nav2);
nav1
XPathNavigator

XPathNavigator object to compare.

nav2
XPathNavigator

XPathNavigator object to compare.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value that is true if two nodes have the same node type and, if nodes of that node type have expanded names, the same expanded names.

LangToLcid(String,Boolean)

Converts the language identifier (as specified in the xml:lang attribute) to the culture identifier (LCID).

public int LangToLcid (string lang, bool forwardCompatibility);
lang
String

String that indicates language.

forwardCompatibility
Boolean

Boolean value that is true if language is forward compatible.

Returns
Int32

A string that contains the culture identifier.

NumberFormat(IList<XPathItem>,String,Double,String,String,Double)

Gets a string that indicates the number format.

public string NumberFormat (System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> value, string formatString, double lang, string letterValue, string groupingSeparator, double groupingSize);
value
IList<XPathItem>

stem.Collections.Generic.IList`1 of strings that represent arguments to the method.

formatString
String

Double that indicates the format string.

lang
Double

Double that indicates the language.

letterValue
String

String that contains the letter value.

groupingSeparator
String

String that contains the grouping separator.

groupingSize
Double

Double that contains the grouping size.

Returns
String

A string that indicates the number format. Used for internal infrastructure only.

RegisterDecimalFormat(XmlQualifiedName,String,String,String)

Registers a decimal-format with the given expanded name. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

public int RegisterDecimalFormat (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName name, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters);
name
XmlQualifiedName

XmlQualifiedName object that contains name.

infinitySymbol
String

String containing infinity symbol.

nanSymbol
String

String containing NaN symbol.

characters
String

String containing characters to format.

Returns
Int32

In the current implementation the return value is always 0.

RegisterDecimalFormatter(String,String,String,String)

Registers a decimal formatter object and returns a unique index assigned to it. The decimal formatter object is used by the format-number() XSLT function. For more information, see the number formatting section in the W3C Recommendation.

public double RegisterDecimalFormatter (string formatPicture, string infinitySymbol, string nanSymbol, string characters);
formatPicture
String

String that contains the format picture.

infinitySymbol
String

String that contains the infinity symbol.

nanSymbol
String

String that contains the NaN symbol.

characters
String

String that contains characters to format.

Returns
Double

Returns a unique index of type Double assigned to a decimal formatter object.

RelationalOperator(Double,IList<XPathItem>,IList<XPathItem>)

Evaluates whether the left expression is greater than or equal to, or less than or equal to, the right expression based on the opCode passed.

public bool RelationalOperator (double opCode, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> left, System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Xml.XPath.XPathItem> right);
opCode
Double

Specifies how to perform the evaluation of two expressions:

If opCode is equal to 2, evaluates the XPath expression "left < right".

If opCode is equal to 3, evaluates the XPath expression "left <= right".

If opCode is equal to 4, evaluates the XPath expression "left > right".

If opCode is equal to 5, evaluates the XPath expression "left >= right"

left
IList<XPathItem>

Expression to evaluate.

right
IList<XPathItem>

Expression to evaluate.

Returns
Boolean

A Boolean value that is true if the left expression is greater than or equal to the right expression.
